title: Both Arcane: League Of Legends Steelbook Editions Get Big, Limited-Time Amazon Discounts

These are limited-time Amazon deals, so you'll want to snag them as soon as possible. Arcane's 4K Limited Edition Steelbook is available for only $41 (was $60), while the standard Blu-ray Limited Edition Steelbook is discounted to $37.33 (was $55). That means you can get both for roughly $88 (was $115). And big Arcane fans may actually want both, because each steelbook features one of the main characters: Jinx (4K) or Vi (1080p).With the second and final season of Arcane set to premiere on Netflix on November 2, it's the perfect time to watch the stellar animated show. See all Arcane Season 1 Physical Editions Continue Reading at GameSpot
excerpt: Season 1 of the groundbreaking League of Legends Netflix animated series released on 4K and 1080p Blu-ray on October 8.

html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Season 1 of Arcane: League of Legends released on 4K and standard Blu-ray earlier this month with a pair of limited editions, and Amazon is already offering big discounts on both. These are limited-time Amazon deals, so you'll want to snag them as soon as possible. Arcane's 4K Limited Edition Steelbook is available for only $41 (was $60), while the standard Blu-ray Limited Edition Steelbook is discounted to $37.33 (was $55). That means you can get both for roughly $88 (was $115). And big Arcane fans may actually want both, because each steelbook features one of the main characters: Jinx (4K) or Vi (1080p).

With the second and final season of Arcane set to premiere on Netflix on November 2, it's the perfect time to watch the stellar animated show.

  • Arcane 4K Blu-ray - Limited Edition Steelbook (4 Discs) -- $41 ($60)
  • Arcane Blu-ray - Limited Edition Steelbook (3 Discs) -- $37.33 ($55)
  • Arcane Blu-ray (3 Discs) -- $33.85 ($45)
  • The Art and Making of Arcane -- $54 ($60) | Preorder

Arcane Limited Edition Steelbook on 4K Blu-ray (Season 1)

$41 (was $60)

Arcane's 4K Blu-ray Limited Edition Steelbook features Jinx cover art and is on sale for $41 as a limited-time Amazon deal. It's unclear when Amazon's deal ends, but retail price is $60. This edition comes with three 4K discs and a standard Blu-ray disc with special features.

Arcane Season 1's physical editions include the full nine-episode arc and three hours of special features. Fans can go behind the scenes of Arcane with exclusive conversations involving key creative talent and writers, numerous scene breakdowns from the animation staff at studio Fortiche, making-of videos, and more.

Here's the full breakdown of the bonus features

  • Bridging the Rift: The making of Arcane
  • "Making Mel" featurette
  • "Happy Progress Day" scene breakdown
  • "When these walls come tumbling down" scene breakdown
  • Ekko vs Jinx: scene breakdown
  • "The monster you created" scene breakdown

The Art and Making of Arcane (Hardcover Book)

$54 (was $60)

It doesn't have a firm release date yet--Amazon lists it as December 31, which is typically a placeholder--but The Art and Making of Arcane is available to preorder for $54 (was $60) at Amazon. This 224-page hardcover comes with an acetate dust jacket with the exclusive art shown above, while the cover itself inverses the illustration's color scheme.

Along with never-before-seen concept art, the book contains over 20 interviews with key team members who created the show.

For Arcane fans looking to go all out, there's an Arcane Collector's Edition available from GKids Films. Normally $200, it has been discounted to $150 and includes original artwork, a diecast D20 dice, resin dice, a velvet dice pouch, double-sided poster, six art cards, and a fabric map.

With elaborate and imaginative animation, production on the sequel series has taken a long time, but the second and final season will debut on Netflix in a few months. The first season featured a stacked cast of performers, including Hailee Steinfeld (Vi), Annie Award winner Ella Purnell (Jinx), Katie Leung (Caitlyn), Reed Shannon (Ekko), Amirah Vann (Sevika), Mick Wingert (Heimerdinger), Ellen Thomas (Ambessa), and Brett Tucker (Singed).

Set in the League of Legends universe--the massively popular video game franchise made by made by Riot Games--Arcane follows iconic League champions Vi and Jinx as they get caught up in the power struggles between the utopian city of Piltover and the oppressed underground city of Zaun. Debuting in November 2021, the show received critical acclaim for its storytelling, incredible animation, and getting that one Imagine Dragons song stuck in your head for several months.

Arcane is one of the best animated shows in recent years, but Season 2 will sadly be its last.
